sentences.english: Some fancy confections come decorated with warring couples made out of icing.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕上通常裝飾有用糖衣製作的怨偶形象。

sentences.english: Those who follow this practice are called Furies .
sentences.chinese: 那些施行此精煉的魔偶叫做“怨偶”。

definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lit. to lift the tray to eyebrow level (idiom); mutual respect in a marriage
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
see 有情人終成眷屬|有情人终成眷属[you3 qing2 ren2 zhong1 cheng2 juan4 shu3]
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
married couple very much in love/deep conjugal love
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
